ratings.comment: Just wait until he retires. Class curriculum badly needs update, he's wishy-washy and inconsistent, takes forever grading, and lectures aren't very useful since you can probably read off the slides better than he can. I can at least respect a prof who's bad because they'd rather be researching, this guy's just frustrating and slightly sad.

I wish he would retire. The course is useless, his lectures make you fall asleep, and everything about it is useless and dated. I wish they would just cancel his whole class. If I could rate my classes and professors, then this class and professor would be at the bottom of that list.

To start, Roessler doesn't even teach our class, he had the TA teach it instead. The class is not intuitive, and there's no certain way to solve problems, you just are somewhat expected to know how to visualize in 3D and figure it out yourself. Roessler takes nearly a month to grade exams, and the homework can be confusing and time consuming. E

Note: class attended fall 2021

Avoid. Disorganized. mistakes in homeworks  and exams.

I have seen Roessler a total of three times throughout the semester. Taught entirely by the TA who was also tasked with grading all the homework of every student. TA carried this class, was often lackluster teaching wise but props to him. All Roessler did was grade exams, and wouldn't even upload online lectures. This class took years off my life.

Prof Roessler didn't even teach the class. The TA did it, and the TA was confused a lot. There is a lot of homework, but it usually was not too difficult. The exams were essentially harder versions of the homework. The worst part about the class is that I had to pay 50 dollars for a drawing kit that we only used for about a third of the semester.

If I could rate him zero stars I would. Teaches the most useless class at UW, takes MONTHS to grade things, not enough examples of the useless topics he teaches, and overall Im surprised his rating is as high as it is.

Jeff doesn't really teach he class. He reads a power point that is not very helpful in and of itself. Then, he assigns homework more difficult that what he taught that is due before the next lecture so it is difficult to ask for help. He also takes a few weeks to grade assignments so you never know how you're doing in the course.

Often said in class that the material was "easy" and "understandable." Held his office hours primarily on Zoom for the semester for an in-person drawing course, which did not assist students very well. Class was poorly structured and exams were either ridiculously hard or ridiculously easy. Additionally, only taught lectures once per week.

Tons and tons of homework when lecture was rarely helpful. He seemed very unprepared for a lot of lectures and it was incredibly difficult to set up accommodations or get in contact with him. A lot of the material felt useless (especially CADjs) or like busywork. The class itself isnt difficult, just a frustrating experience.

dont know why CADjs still exists and why we learn it but the bulk of midterm 1 was on that terrible software. Also dont bother with lecture, not super helpful and sometimes a waste of time. Some homeworks took at least 10 hours and grading is super slow.
He seems easy at first, but his tests can be a bit tricky, watch out
Overall solid professor. A bit above average perhaps.

The examples he does in class and on the homework are simple and the labs are not that bad. But, he writes the midterm and final in such a way that is ridiculously challenging with the time constraint. You need to understand the material perfectly to do good on the midterms. Referring to old exams are very helpful.

Class more so consisted of examples than instruction, so I was left confused as to how to do the techniques in graphics. Your success relies on your relationships with your classmates, as group work is encouraged and even necessary once or twice. Things are simple at first, but halfway through the semester things change. Don't be caught unprepared.
Jeff is an alright lecturer, not much good nor bad. Lectures were pretty boring but I don't blame him since the material is so bland. The class in general didn't require much work.

One of my main complaints with Jeff is his dryness in lectures and how disconnected lecture feels from homework. Although the topic is the same, he will often expect us to use techniques beyond what instructed in lecture without being taught. He is also a very dry, but thorough, lecturer. Be prepared to hear his life story on the first day.
Jeff is a great guy and a very clear teacher. His only weakness is that his lectures are often pretty dry and hard to focus on. Not necessarily his fault, just not very exciting content matter.

I personally like the way that Jeff teaches, he is very precise with expectations. Sometimes the homework can have curveballs thrown in, but overall they help with the material. He gives real-world applicably to the material with a little history on each topic; I like this because it gives the material meaning and incentive to know/study it.
Not a bad lecturer, just not alot of content in the course so it goes very slow. Tough grader on neatness, work must be VERY neat and clean.

ME 170 was a great class. I had one of the TA's as my lecture leader, but Jeff was the man behind the curtain. The labs were straightforward and I always finished my homework assignments before leaving class. Tests were fair and graded pretty easily. The final project was done mostly in class. Easy A if you can visualize in 3D
Does not even teach his classes. He gives painfully hard tests that are ten times harder than any other assignments.

One of my least favorite professors at UW. Lectures are pointless and he's often found repeating things in lecture 4-5 times. He makes mistakes often so you're never sure what to follow and what not to. Boring course, even more boring professor. Material isn't hard but the homework assignments are long and tedious and make you want to rather fail.
Not too difficult. Time consuming at certain points in semester
Very helpful for those who want to put in the work to be successful

Jeff is a good professor. Lecture time is boring, but I'm not sure how one could make this topic very thrilling either. He seems very shy, but is always willing to help! He is a tough grader, but if you put the time and effort into the homework you'll be fine! Neatness is extremely important in this class. Tests were fair.

Jeff is extremely clear in his expectations and is very helpful. He teaches the material in a manner that is easy to understand. Gives you work time during which he grades homework but is available to help you whenever you need. He's a tough grader but he's very fair and has a calming personality.

He is so, so, so bad. Boring, tedious, monotone, makes exams really hard -- things you've never seen on HW. Labs are irrelevant to the stuff he teaches. Worst courseinstructor I have taken at this school and it's not close

Jeff was always there for help if you had any trouble. The class was very easy though and was somewhat fun. Personally I would rather draw stuff than do a math problem or write a paper. Easy A if you can visualize.

No idea how this guy has good ratings. I'm doing well, but he's just bad. his lectures are AWFUL. the most boring thing you'll ever experience -- guarantee you won't show up at all by the time the semester is halfway through. non-stop tedious and boring homework assignments at terrible times. right before finals, day after spring break. AVOID!
Jeff is such a genuinely nice guy. The class can be hard for people who don't have great visualization skills but he is very approachable and available with any questions

while doing the exam you'll think you're doing pretty good, everyone was surprised with how low the midterm average was. homework is super easy and labs are as well. guys really nice, he and the TA's always have office hours.. mine had no textbook at all

Jeff is a really nice guy and he grades very fairly, but if you do not do well on one exam it is impossible to get an A in the class. I had a 97, and 88, and a  78, and even with As on the project and homework I could not get a solid A.

This class is really hard if you cannot visualize 3D objects. It can be a wake up call for some. If your good at visualizing you will find the class fun and rather easy. BE AWARE IF YOU CANT VISUALIZE IT CAN BE DOWNRIGHT MISERABLE!
Great teacher. He genuinely wants you to understand the material, and creates a laid back atmosphere in the class. Overall a really enjoyable class

Class was easy.  There are three midterms and a final project. No final exam! He goes over examples of problems in class and gives you extra practice problems for test.  If you don't understand something he is willing to help. This claass was an easy A.
I took the class in 3 weeks really fast paced.  We had to squeeze a lot in, but Jeff made it possible.

Jeff does a decent job of teaching the course. It is interesting and enjoyable. He talks in the beginning of class to explain material and then gives you some work time. This makes it easy to ask him questions if you don't understand the techniques.  He is helpful and not too difficult of a grader. Very easygoing and a laid back atmosphere.

He's a bit dry in lecture, but he teaches you everything you need to know. You will be very pressed for time in his exams; they aren't hard, per say, but you really need to be on top of the problems if you're going to finish everything. Go in for help right away if you don't understand something. The class should be an easy A.

do not buy books, and the only tools u need are the triangles, ruler, eraser, and a mechanical pencil if u dont already have one (u wont use anything else)  the class is pretty straightforward and fairly graded - kind of takes a lot of time up tho.. jeffs lectures are kinda boring but try to pay attention cause itll save time in lab

I never thought this class would be as difficult as it was. The assignments take forever! Best to take this one during the summer. Mr Roessler was always helpful however, and answers questions without making you feel dumb. He's a good instructor, and class itself is pretty fun.
Class was not bad at all and actually pretty intresting for future civil engineers hes good at explaining and glad to help
This ****en class is hard, I never though drafting would be this hard. If you dont "see" or "picture" the stuff in 3D you are screwed, but if you do then it will be easy
No Comments
go to class and you'll be fine
Nice guy. Very helpful and willing to answer questions. Drafting sucks but if you go to class and do the work you will do fine

Easy class. Lectures are incredibly boring, but you should go because it definitely makes the homework and exams easier. He also might give away a test question or give out a small quiz to make sure people are showing up. Answers questions well.
No Comments
Very good professor. He explains everything clearly and is very approachable. The exams are easy if you go to lectures and take minimal notes. Easy A.
Kind of boring, but it's drafting so who cares? It's easy.
kind of monotone but a good teacher and willing to help.
No Comments
